properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 5 at 10:46PM CST until February 6 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON...

.Multiple rounds of moderate to heavy rainfall are expected
through Thursday afternoon as showers and thunderstorms move
across much of Central Alabama. Widespread rainfall totals of two
to four inches are possible, with locally higher amounts. This
will result in the potential for some flash flooding and flooding
of streams and low lying areas.

The National Weather Service in Birmingham has expanded the

* Flash Flood Watch to include a portion of west central
Alabama, including the following areas, Greene, Hale, Marengo,
Sumter, and Tuscaloosa.

* Through Thursday afternoon

* Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms with widespread 2
to 4 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
